LURASIDONE HYDROCHLORIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Drug action
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Schizophrenia,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 37 mg once daily, increased if necessary up to 148 mg once daily.

Schizophrenia when given with concomitant moderate CYP3A4 inhibitors (e.g. diltiazem, erythromycin, fluconazole, and verapamil),

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 18.5 mg once daily (max. per dose 74 mg once daily).

Dose adjustments due to interactions

Initially 18.5 mg once daily, up to max. 74 mg once daily with concomitant moderate CYP3A4 inhibitors (e.g. diltiazem, erythromycin, fluconazole, and verapamil.

Drug action

Lurasidone is a dopamine D2, 5-HT2A, 5-HT7, alpha2A- and alpha2C- adrenoceptor antagonist, and is a partial agonist at 5-HT1a receptors.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Use only if potential benefit outweighs risk—limited information available.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Initially 18.5 mg once daily, up to max. 74 mg once daily in moderate impairment.

Use with caution in severe impairment—initially 18.5 mg once daily, up to max. 37 mg once daily.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Initially 18.5 mg once daily, up to max. 74 mg once daily if eGFR less than 50 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit outweighs risk if eGFR less than 15 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Anxiety, musculoskeletal stiffness,

uncommon: Catatonia, decreased appetite, dysarthria, dysuria, hot flush, myalgia, nightmares,

notKnown: Angina, AV block, bradycardia, dysphagia, panic attacks, pruritus, suicidal behaviour, vertigo,

Directions for administration

Patients on doses higher than 111 mg once daily whose treatment is interrupted for longer than 3 days should restart on 111 mg once daily and titrate to usual dose; for all other doses, restart on usual dose.

Cautions regarding administration

  • High doses in elderly
  • susceptibility to QT-interval prolongation

Prepared medicinal forms of LURASIDONE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.
